== Welcome! == {| style="background-color:#F5FFFA; padding:0;" |class="MainPageBG" style="border:1px solid lightgrey; background-color:lightgrey; vertical-align:top; color:#000000; font-size:85%"| {| style="width: 100%; padding: 0px; vertical-align:top; background-color:lavender; padding:0;" !
Hello, TechKnowledgey20! '''[[Wikipedia:Introduction|Welcome]] to Wikipedia!''' Thank you for [[Special:Contributions/TechKnowledgey20|your contributions]]. You may benefit from following some of the links below, which will help you get the most out of Wikipedia. If you have any questions you can ask me on my talk page, or place '''{{helpme}}''' on your [[Help:Using talk pages|talk page]] and ask your question there. Please remember to [[Wikipedia:Signatures|sign your name]] on talk pages by clicking [[File:Insert-signature.png|link=Wikipedia:How to sign your posts|alt=]] or by typing four tildes "~~~~"; this will automatically produce your name and the date. If you are already excited about Wikipedia, you might want to consider being "[[Wikipedia:Adopt-a-user|adopted]]" by a more experienced editor or joining a [[Wikipedia:WikiProject|WikiProject]] to collaborate with others in creating and improving articles of your interest. Click [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Council/Directory|here]] for a directory of all the WikiProjects. Finally, please do your best to always fill in the [[Help:Edit summary|edit summary]] field when making edits to pages. Happy editing! [[User:I dream of horses|I dream of horses]] If you reply here, please [[WP:ECHO|ping me]] by adding {{U|I dream of horses}} to your message. {{small|([[User talk:I dream of horses|talk to me]]) ([[Special:Contributions/I dream of horses|contributions]])}} @ 03:08, 4 May 2015 (UTC) |} {| width="100%" style="background-color:white;" |class="MainPageBG" style="width: 55%; border:1px solid white; background-color:lightgrey; vertical-align:top"| {| style="width: 100%; padding: 0px; vertical-align:top; background-color:Lavender" !

You may prevent the proposed deletion by removing the {{Tlc|proposed deletion/dated}} notice, but please explain why in your [[Help:edit summary|edit summary]] or on [[{{TALKPAGENAME:Amohdoh}}|the article's talk page]]. Please consider improving the article to address the issues raised. Removing {{Tlc|proposed deletion/dated}} will stop the [[Wikipedia:Proposed deletion|proposed deletion process]], but other [[Wikipedia:deletion process|deletion process]]es exist. In particular, the [[Wikipedia:Criteria for speedy deletion|speedy deletion]] process can result in deletion without discussion, and [[Wikipedia:Articles for deletion|articles for deletion]] allows discussion to reach [[Wikipedia:Consensus|consensus]] for deletion. [[User:Wgolf|Wgolf]] ([[User talk:Wgolf|talk]]) 00:26, 28 May 2015 (UTC)

title: User talk:Official djsnaija
content:
[[Image:Stop_x_nuvola.svg|left|35px|alt=]]Your account has been '''[[Wikipedia:Blocking policy|blocked]] indefinitely''' from editing Wikipedia because it appears to be mainly intended for publicity and/or promotional purposes. If you intend to edit constructively in other topic areas, you ''may'' be granted the right to continue under a change of username. Please read the following carefully.
;Why can't I edit Wikipedia? [[Special:MyContributions|Your account's edits]] and/or [[Special:MyPage|username]] indicate that it is being used on behalf of a company, group, website or organization for purposes of promotion and/or publicity. The edits may have violated one or more of our rules on spamming, which include: [[Wikipedia:Spam#External link spamming|adding inappropriate external links]], [[WP:Spam|posting advertisements]] and [[Wikipedia:What Wikipedia is not#Wikipedia is not a soapbox or means of promotion|using Wikipedia for promotion]]. Wikipedia has many articles on [[:Category:Companies|companies]], groups, and [[:Category:Organizations|organizations]], but such groups are generally discouraged from using Wikipedia to write about themselves. ''In addition'', usernames like yours are disallowed under our [[Wikipedia:Username policy#Promotional names|username policy]].
;Am I allowed to make these edits if I change my username? Probably not, although if you can demonstrate a pattern of future editing in strict accordance with our [[Wikipedia:neutral point of view|neutral point of view]] policy, you ''may'' be granted this right. See [[WP:FAQ/Organizations|Wikipedia's FAQ for Organizations]] for a helpful list of frequently asked questions by people in your position. Also, review the [[WP:Conflict of interest|conflict of interest guidance]] to see the kinds of limitations you would have to obey if you did want to continue editing about your company, group, organization, or clients. If this does not fit in with your goals, then you will not be allowed to edit Wikipedia again. ;What can I do now? If you have no interest in writing about some other topic than your organization, group, company, or product, you may consider using [[WP:Alternative outlets|one of the many websites]] that allow this instead. If you ''do'' intend to make useful contributions here about some other topic, you must convince a [[Wikipedia:Administrators|Wikipedia administrator]] that you mean it. To that end, please do the following: *Add the text {{tlx|unblock-spamun|Your proposed new username|Your reason here}} on [[Special:MyTalk|your user talk page]]. *Replace the text "Your proposed new username" with a new username you are willing to use. See [[Special:Listusers]] to search for available usernames. Your new username will need to meet our [[Wikipedia:Username policy|username policy]]. *Replace the text "Your reason here" with your reason to be unblocked. In this reason, you must: **Convince us that you understand the reason for your block and that you will not repeat the edits for which you were blocked. **Describe in general terms the contributions that you intend to make if you are unblocked. If you believe this block was made in error, you may [[Wikipedia:Appealing a block|appeal this block]] by adding the text {{tlx|unblock|Your reason here}} below, but you should read the [[Wikipedia:Guide to appealing blocks|guide to appealing blocks]] first.
[[Category:Wikipedians who are indefinitely blocked for promotional user names|{{PAGENAME}}]]{{z17}}--[[User:Orangemike|Orange Mike]] | [[User talk:Orangemike|Talk]] 05:21, 12 December 2014 (UTC)

title: User:Pictonsl/sandbox
content:
{{User sandbox}}
<!-- EDIT BELOW THIS LINE -->

MOMODOU CEESAY was born in Banjul, Gambia.  December 3rd 1945 in the Gambia

Early Years
Momodou Ceesay was born in 1945 and grew up in Banjul, Gambia. He moved to America in 1964 to continue his schooling, followed by undergraduate studies at the College of
Letters, Wesleyan University.

It was during his studies that his early interest in art was developed by Professor SamuelGreen, an accomplished watercolourist and Professor of Art History at Wesleyan University.
They first met in 1964 in Banjul, while the Professor was there on sabbatical. Ceesay developed his watercolour techniques from watching the Professor work and acquired a
lifetime commitment to using the highest quality art materials.

As part of his degree programme Ceesay also spent a year in France, continuing his studies at the University de Poitiers (Tours) and La Sorbonne (Paris). There, he was strongly
influenced by his experiences of seeing the originals of Picasso as well as by the student riots. The cries for freedom were everywhere, and on his return he found the same wind
of change blowing in America. He moved to a Black House which had been set up by his student colleagues at the University. While there he met Clifford Thornton, a teacher at
Wesleyan and also a member of the Black Panthers.

1970-1976: American Beginnings
After graduating with a BA in General Studies in 1970, Ceesay moved to Boston to study Electronic Engineering. At this time he also began studying martial arts which he found
brought not only discipline but also enhanced his creative spiritual process, bringing an open meditative state and the ability to function within a stream of consciousness, a
philosophy Ceesay continues to maintain in his artwork. In 1971 Ceesay decided to leave his electronic engineering studies to devote himself full-time to art. He began teaching at the Elma Lewis School of Fine Arts where he learned the art of silk screening under Oolong Smith.

In 1972, responding to an invitation from Edmund Barry Gaither, The Director of the National Centre of African American Artists, Ceesay participated in the exhibition ‘Kindred Spirits’, which included works by the renowned African-American artist Charles White and the Nigerian artist Chief Z.K. Olaruntuba.

In the following year, 1973, Ceesay moved to Los Angeles where he set up a screen printing studio and by 1976 was travelling widely to attend artist residencies and
exhibitions around the world, including Columbia, Taiwan, Yugoslavia and Nigeria. His work was recognised and collected by investors and major Corporations alike.

1977-1983: Establishing African Roots
In 1977 Ceesay returned to The Gambia. He set up the Kayor Art Gallery exhibiting the works of Gambian and Senegalese artists. He provided design and illustrations for
Government and Academic publications, and produced the first billboards in The Gambia through his own Media Agency.

Ceesay’s early education was in The Gambia followed by scholarships and academic studies at Suffield 
Academy and Wesleyan University, Connecticut (USA). He continued his studies in France at the University de Poitiers, Tours and La Sorbonne, Paris.

Following his academic studies, Ceesay chose to pursue a career as a fine artist. His highly individualistic vision is reflected in the uniqueness of his style and use of color. This can be seen across the variety of media and 
methods he employs.

‘My art is an exploration of images rooted in my culture and heritage that take the viewer on a spiritual 
odyssey...’ MOMODOU CEESAY

title: User:Presidentman/potd/9 November 2009
Maciej Łukaszczyk
content:
{{unreferenced|date=July 2014}}

'''Maciej Łukaszczyk''' (11 March 1934, [[Warsaw]] – 2 June 2014, [[Poznań]]) was a [[Poland|Polish]] [[pianist]].

== Life ==
Łukaszczyk was born in the capital city of Poland, Warsaw, on March 1934. During the [[Occupation of Poland (1939–45)|German occupation of Poland]] during the [[Second World War]], he and his twin brother [[Jacek Łukaszczyk]] (1934–2013) were engrossed with the music of [[Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart]]. In the '50s he studied at the [[Fryderyk Chopin University of Music|Higher State School of Music in Warsaw]]. His professors were [[Margerita Trombini-Kazuro]], [[Zbigniew Drzewiecki]], and [[Jan Ekier]]. Later he studied at the [[University of Music and Performing Arts, Vienna]] under [[Hans Kann]]. He became intensely interested in the music of [[Frédéric Chopin]]. In Inland and abroad he became an interpreter of Chopin. In 1966,  Łukaszczyk arrived in [[Darmstadt]], and initially worked there as an [[Répétiteur]] at the [[Landestheater Darmstadt]].

In 1970 he founded the Chopin-Gesellschaft in Darmstadt, of whom he was president for 44 years. The Chopin-Gesellschaft organized concerts, piano competitions, and master courses of the supraregional music of Chopin. Łukaszczyk persistently campaigned for comprehension between Poland and Germany.

== Distinctions ==
* 1991: Tribute for [[Order of Merit of the Federal Republic of Germany]].
* 1999: [[Order of Merit of the Republic of Poland]].
* 2004: Johann-Heinrich-Merck-Distinction of the city Darmstadt.

== External links ==
* [http://www.echo-online.de/region/darmstadt/Maciej-Lukaszczyk-gestorben;art1231,5114865 Maciej Lukaszczyk died.] obituary in regional newspaper Darmstädter Echo  5. June 2014 (German)

title: Sea breeze
content:
{{hatnote|"Offshore wind" redirects here. For sea breezes' use as a renewable energy source, see [[Offshore wind power]]. For other uses, see [[Sea breeze (disambiguation)]] and [[Bay breeze (disambiguation)]].}}
[[File:Sea-breeze in Hobart.jpg|thumb|300px||Sea breeze moving across the water (towards the viewer)]]
[[Image:LAKE BREEZE.gif|thumb|250px|Lake - Sea breeze and atmospheric depth]]

A '''sea breeze''' or '''onshore breeze''' is a gentle [[wind]] that develops over [[bodies of water]] near [[land]] due to differences in [[air pressure]] created by their different [[heat capacity]]. It is a common occurrence along coasts during the morning as [[solar radiation]] heats the land more quickly than the water. A '''land breeze''' or '''offshore breeze''' is the reverse effect, caused by land cooling more quickly than water in the evening. The sea breeze dissipates and the wind flows from the land towards the sea. Both are important factors in coastal regions' [[prevailing winds]].<ref>{{cite web|author=Dr. Steve Ackerman|year=1995|url=http://cimss.ssec.wisc.edu/wxwise/seabrz.html|title=Sea and Land Breezes|publisher=[[University of Wisconsin]]|accessdate=2006-10-24}}</ref>

'''Offshore wind''' refers more generally to any wind over open water. [[Offshore wind farm]]s take advantage of the higher [[wind speed]]s available over [[the sea]], but are usually placed near coasts to reduce costs and to take advantage of daily flows of sea and land breezes. [[Nearshore wind farm]]s are those closest to land, while others are further out to sea.

==Cause==
The sea has a greater [[heat capacity]] than land, so the surface of the sea warms up more slowly than the land's surface.<ref>University of Wisconsin. [http://cimss.ssec.wisc.edu/wxwise/seabrz.html Sea and Land Breezes.] Retrieved on 2006-10-24.</ref> As the temperature of the surface of the [[landform|land]] rises, the land heats the air above it by [[Thermal conduction|conduction]].  The warm air is less dense and so it expands, decreasing the pressure over the land near the coast. The air above the sea has a relatively higher pressure, causing air near the coast to flow towards the lower pressure over land.  The strength of the sea breeze is directly proportional to the temperature difference between the land and the sea.  If a strong offshore wind is present, that is, a wind greater than {{convert|sp=us|8|kn|km/h}} and opposing the direction of a possible sea breeze, the sea breeze is not likely to develop.<ref name="Jet"/>

==Effects==
[[Image:SeaBreeze.svg|thumb|right|441px|Schematic cross section through a sea-breeze front. If the air inland is moist, cumulus often marks the front.]]
A '''sea-breeze front''' is a [[weather front]] created by a sea breeze, also known as a [[convergence zone]].  The cold air from the sea meets the warmer air from the land and creates a boundary like a shallow [[cold front]].  When powerful this front creates [[cumulus cloud|cumulus]] clouds, and if the air is [[humid]] and [[unstable]], [[cumulonimbus cloud|cumulonimbus]] clouds, the front can sometimes trigger [[thunderstorm]]s.  If the flow aloft is aligned with the direction of the sea breeze, places experiencing the sea breeze frontal passage will be benign, or fair, weather for the remainder of the day.  At the front warm air continues to flow upward and cold air continually moves in to replace it and so the front moves progressively inland.  Its speed depends on whether it is assisted or hampered by the prevailing wind, and the strength of the thermal contrast between land and sea.  At night, the sea breeze usually changes to a land breeze, due to a reversal of the same mechanisms.

===Sea breezes in Florida===
{{seealso|Climate of Florida}}
[[Image:Cubanseabreezeconvergence.gif|thumb|right|250px|Sea breeze convergence in [[Cuba]] is very similar to that in [[Florida]]. The northern sea breeze meets the southern sea breeze, creating a sharp convergence line in the [[Cumulus cloud|cumulus]] field.]]

Thunderstorms caused by powerful sea breeze fronts frequently occur in [[Florida]], a [[peninsula]] surrounded on both the east and west by the [[Atlantic Ocean]] and [[Gulf of Mexico]], respectively.  During the wet season which typically lasts from June through September/October, any direction that the winds are blowing would always be off the water, thus making Florida the place most often struck by [[lightning]] in the [[United States]], and one of the most on Earth. <ref>[http://www.lightning.ece.ufl.edu/ Lightning Research Laboratory (UF)]. Lightning.ece.ufl.edu. Retrieved on 2009-02-06.</ref> These storms also can produce significant [[hail]] due to the tremendous [[updraft]] it causes in the [[Earth's atmosphere|atmosphere]] especially during times when the upper atmosphere is cooler such as during the spring or fall.

On calm summer afternoons with little prevailing wind, sea breezes from both coasts may collide in the middle, creating especially severe storms down the center of the state. These thunderstorms can drift towards either the west or east coast depending on the relative strengths of the sea breezes, and sometimes survive to move out over the water at night, creating spectacular cloud-to-cloud lightning shows for hours after sunset. <ref>Winsberg, Morton (2003). Florida Weather. Gainesville: University Press of Florida. ISBN 0-8130-2684-9.</ref><ref>Henry, James (1998). The Climate and Weather of Florida. Sarasota, Florida: Pineapple Press (FL). ISBN 1-56164-036-0.</ref>

==Land breeze==
At night, the land cools off faster than the ocean due to differences in their heat capacity, which forces the dying of the daytime sea breeze as the temperature of the land approaches that of the ocean. If the land becomes cooler than the adjacent [[sea surface temperature]], the air pressure over the water will be lower than that of the land, setting up a land breeze blowing from the land to the sea, as long as the environmental surface wind pattern is not strong enough to oppose it. If there is sufficient moisture and instability available, the land breeze can cause showers, or even thunderstorms, over the water. Overnight thunderstorm development offshore due to the land breeze can be a good predictor for the activity on land the following day, as long as there are no expected changes to the weather pattern over the following 12–24 hours. This is mainly because the strength of the land breeze is weaker than the sea breeze.<ref name="Jet">JetStream:  An Online School For Weather (2008). [http://www.srh.weather.gov/srh/jetstream/ocean/seabreezes.htm The Sea Breeze.] [[National Weather Service]]. Retrieved on 2006-10-24.</ref>  The land breeze will die once the land warms up again the next morning.

==See also==
*[[Fremantle Doctor]], the local name for the sea breeze in and around [[Perth, Western Australia]]
*[[Southerly buster]], a sea breeze, though usually a storm, which is experienced in the southeast coast of [[New South Wales]], southern coast of [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]] and [[New Zealand]]
*[[Mountain breeze and valley breeze]]

==References==
{{reflist}}

==External links==
*[http://www.islandnet.com/~see/weather/elements/seabrz.htm Sea and Land Breezes]

[[Category:Marine meteorology and sailing]]
[[Category:Wind]]

content: == Christian Hein == '''Christian Hein''' was born in year 04. august 1991 in '''Estonia''' place called '''Palometsa'''. He is better know as '''Palo Trip''' or '''Kristjan Hein'''. In the year 2000 '''Christian Hein''' was becoming a leader of '''Palo ST Music Gang''', members of '''PSTMG''' Igor Poslin, Raul Kolk, Mc-R and Carlos Perez. In year 2007 '''Christian Hein''' is acting a host in movie '''PALO TRIP''' is was his first movie. [[Image:Ambox warning pn.svg|48px|left]]The article [[:Christian hein]] has been speedily deleted from Wikipedia. This was done because the article, which appeared to be about a real person, organization (band, club, company, ''etc.''), or web content, did not indicate how or why the subject is notable, that is, why an article about that subject should be included in Wikipedia. Under the [[WP:CSD#Articles|criteria for speedy deletion]], articles that do not indicate the notability of the subject may be deleted at any time. If you can indicate why the subject is really notable, you are free to re-create the article, making sure to [[Wikipedia:Citing sources|cite]] any [[Wikipedia:Verifiability|verifiable sources]]. Please [[Wikipedia:Notability|see the guidelines for what is generally accepted as notable]], and for specific types of articles, you may want to check out our criteria [[Wikipedia:Notability (people)|for biographies]], [[WP:WEB|for web sites]], [[WP:MUSIC|for musicians]], or [[WP:CORP|for companies]]. Feel free to leave a note on my talk page if you have any questions about this. This has been done under [[WP:CSD#A7|section A7 of the criteria for speedy deletion]], because the article appears to be about a person or group of people, but it does not indicate how or why the subject is notable: that is, why an article about that subject should be included in an encyclopedia. Under the [[WP:CSD#Articles|criteria for speedy deletion]], articles that do not indicate the subject's importance or significance may be deleted at any time. Please [[Wikipedia:Notability|see the guidelines for what is generally accepted as notable]], as well as our subject-specific [[Wikipedia:Notability (people)|notability guideline for biographies]]. If you think that this notice was placed here in error, you may contest the deletion by adding {{tl|hangon}} to '''the top of [[:Christian hein|the page that has been nominated for deletion]]''' (just below the existing speedy deletion or "db" tag), coupled with adding a note on '''[[ Talk:Christian hein|the talk page]]''' explaining your position, but be aware that once tagged for ''speedy'' deletion, if the article meets the criterion it may be deleted without delay. title: Snows Farm Nature Reserve
content:
{{Infobox park
| name = Snows Farm Nature Reserve
| photo = Yellow-wort.jpeg
| photo_width = 200
| photo_caption = Example - yellow-wort (''Blackstonia perfoliata'')
| type = Gloucestershire Wildlife Trust nature reserve
| location = head of Slad Valley near Stroud
| map = Gloucestershire
| map_caption = Snows Farm Nature Reserve shown within Gloucestershire
| lat_d =  51  | lat_m =  46  | lat_s = 18.87   | lat_NS = N
| long_d = 2  | long_m =  9 | long_s = 52 | long_EW = W
| area = {{convert|52.5  |acre}}
| created = 1975 by agreement, donated in 1989 to Trust
| operator = Gloucestershire Wildlife Trust
| status = Open at all times (with restrictions)
}}
[[Image:Snow's Farm - geograph.org.uk - 962346.jpg|thumb|alt=Alt|Walkers at Snows Farm]]
'''Snows Farm Nature Reserve''' ({{gbmapping|SO887081}}) is a {{convert| 21.3 |ha|adj=on}} nature reserve in [[Gloucestershire]].<ref name="GWT nature reserves handbook">Kelham, A, Sanderson, J, Doe, J, Edgeley-Smith, M, et al., 1979, 1990, 2002 editions, 'Nature Reserves of the Gloucestershire Trust for Nature Conservation/Gloucestershire Wildlife Trust'</ref> The site is listed in the ‘Stroud District’ Local Plan, adopted November 2005, Appendix 6 (online for download) as a Key Wildlife Site (KWS).<ref>[http://www.stroud.gov.uk/docs/planning/planning_strategy.asp#s=sectioncontent1  Stroud District Local Plan, adopted November 2005, Appendix 6 ‘Sites of Nature Conservation Interest’]</ref>

The site is owned and managed by the [[Gloucestershire Wildlife Trust]]. It was held under agreement from 1975, but was donated to the trust in 1989 by Mr. P. Duddridge.<ref name="GWT nature reserves handbook"/>

==Location and habitat==
The reserve is sited at the head of the [[Slad Valley]] and is about three miles north-east of [[Stroud]]. The Dillay Brook runs through its centre.  It is unimproved pasture, woodland and scrub.  The sides of the reserve face south-east and north-west and the stream separates two geological formations. [[Oolite|Oolitic]] [[limestone]] has formed the thin [[Rendzina]] soil of the west facing slope.  The east facing slope has deeper, more neutral soil from Cotteswold Sand.<ref name="GWT nature reserves handbook"/>

The northern end abuts Down Wood. There is an old derelict building known as the ''Old Shop'' at the northern end. All that is left is a walled enclosure and pile of stones. Access is from a track from Slad.<ref name="GWT nature reserves handbook"/><ref>‘Nature Reserve Guide – discover the wild Gloucestershire on your doorstep’ - 50th Anniversary, January 2011, Gloucestershire Wildlife Trust</ref> The reserve is fenced with stiles and gates. Stock may be present on the site.<ref name="Snows Farm">'Snows Farm Nature Reserve – A secret valley paradise for wildlife and people', (undated), Gloucestershire Wildlife Trust</ref>

==Flowers==
The site is rich in wild flowers.  The limestone grassland supports [[early purple orchid]], [[fragrant orchid]] and [[pyramidal orchid]]s, along with [[Gentiana amarella|autumn gentian]], [[vervain]], [[yellow-wort]] and [[clustered bellflower]].  [[Aquilegia vulgaris|Wild columbine]] may also be seen as well as [[Astragalus glycyphyllos|wild liquorice]], [[Ophioglossum|adder's-tongue]], [[stinking hellebore]] and the [[small teasel]].<ref name="GWT nature reserves handbook"/>

The neutral grassland supports [[Stachys officinalis|betony]], [[lousewort]], [[devil's-bit scabious]] and [[lady's-mantle]].  The wetter stream area at the bottom supports [[ramsons]] and [[golden-saxifrage]]. The more marshy areas support [[forget-me-not]], [[brooklime]] and [[marsh-marigold]].<ref name="GWT nature reserves handbook"/> ferns are also present such as [[hart's-tongue]].<ref name="Snows Farm"/>

The ground flora in the woodland at the top of the west slope includes [[moschatel]], [[spurge-laurel]] and [[anemone nemorosa|wood anemone]].  The uncommon fingered [[Carex|sedge]] (''[[Carex digitata]]'') is present.<ref name="GWT nature reserves handbook"/> Over 300 plant species are recorded for this site.<ref name="Snows Farm"/>

==Trees and scrub==
The scrub includes [[dog-rose]], [[field-rose]], [[Crataegus monogyna|hawthorn]], [[dogwood]] and there are [[wayfaring-tree]]s. [[Alder]], [[white willow]], [[Fraxinus excelsior|ash]] and [[hazel]] grow along the edges of the stream.  There is a woodland of [[beech]] and ash at the top of the west slope.  There the scrub includes [[field maple]], hazel and [[Prunus avium|wild cherry]].<ref name="GWT nature reserves handbook"/>

==Bird life==
[[Whitethroat]], [[marsh tit]], [[skylark]], [[tree pipit]] and [[grey wagtail]] are some of the birds recorded at the reserve.  The [[great spotted woodpecker]] is also present.<ref name="GWT nature reserves handbook"/> Over 70 different bird species are recorded for this site.<ref name="Snows Farm"/>

==Invertebrates==
There are good populations recorded of [[small blue]], [[Melanargia galathea|marbled white]] and [[green hairstreak]] butterflies.<ref name="GWT nature reserves handbook"/> Many moths species are recorded including the [[six-spot burnet]].<ref name="Snows Farm"/>  Ant-hills from the [[yellow meadow ant]] are present in the pasture.<ref name="Snows Farm"/> Recorded as plentiful on this site is the [[bloody-nosed beetle]].<ref name="GWT nature reserves handbook"/> The snail (''[[Helicella itala]]'') is seen, and the rare green spider (''[[Micrommata virescens|Micromatta virescens]]'').<ref name="Snows Farm"/>

==Reptiles==
[[Common lizard]] and [[Vipera berus|adder]] may be seen on sunny days.<ref name="Snows Farm"/>

==Conservation==
The traditional management method of sheep grazing is used to control the growth of [[tor-grass]] and [[upright brome]].  This encourages the wild flowers to flourish and to spread. Cattle grazing helps to control scrub, the clearance and control of which is important to maintain the open areas of pasture.<ref name="GWT nature reserves handbook"/> The correct grazing balance has to be maintained - too much will overgraze the site and too little will allow the vigorous grasses to flourish to the detriment of the flowers.<ref name="Snows Farm"/>

==Publications==
{{colbegin}}
* Kelham, A, Sanderson, J, Doe, J, Edgeley-Smith, M, et al., 1979, 1990, 2002 editions, 'Nature Reserves of the Gloucestershire Trust for Nature Conservation/Gloucestershire Wildlife Trust'
* (undated), 'Snow's Farm Reserve Handbook', Gloucestershire Trust for Nature Conservation
* 'Snows Farm Nature Reserve – A secret valley paradise for wildlife and people', (undated), Gloucestershire Wildlife Trust
* ‘Nature Reserve Guide – discover the wild Gloucestershire on your doorstep’ - 50th Anniversary, January 2011, Gloucestershire Wildlife Trust
{{colend}}

==References==
{{Reflist|2}}

==External links==
* [http://www.gloucestershirewildlifetrust.co.uk Gloucestershire Wildlife Trust]

[[Category:Nature reserves in Gloucestershire]]
[[Category:Cotswolds]]

== Your submission at [[WP:AFC|Articles for creation]] ==
[[File:AFC-Logo_Decline.svg|50px|left]]Thank you for your recent submission to [[WP:AFC|Articles for Creation]]. Your article submission has been reviewed. However, the reviewer felt that a few things need to be fixed before it is accepted. Please view your submission to see the comments left by the reviewer. You are welcome to edit the submission to address the issues raised, and resubmit once you feel they have been resolved. (You can do this by adding the text {{subst:submit}} to the top of the article.) * If you would like to continue working on the submission, you can find it at [[Wikipedia talk:Articles for creation/have a cat??what it needs]]. * To edit the submission, you can use the edit button at the top of the article, near the search bar * If you need any assistance, you can ask for help at the [[WP:HD|Help desk]] or the [{{fullurl:User_talk:{{urlencode:Chzz|WIKI}}|action=edit§ion=new}} reviewer's talk page]. Alternatively you can ask a reviewer questions via [http://webchat.freenode.net/?channels=wikipedia-en-help live help] :Thank you for your contributions to Wikipedia! title: User talk:72.128.58.106
content: '''Welcome!''' Hello, {{BASEPAGENAME}}, and [[Wikipedia:Welcome, newcomers|welcome]] to Wikipedia! Thank you for your contributions. I hope you like the place and decide to stay. Here are some pages that you might find helpful: *[[Wikipedia:Five pillars|The five pillars of Wikipedia]] *[[Wikipedia:How to edit a page|How to edit a page]] *[[Help:Contents|Help pages]] *[[Wikipedia:Tutorial|Tutorial]] *[[Wikipedia:Article development|How to write a great article]] *[[Wikipedia:Manual of Style|Manual of Style]] I hope you enjoy editing here and being a [[Wikipedia:Wikipedians|Wikipedian]]! Please [[Wikipedia:Sign your posts on talk pages|sign your name]] on talk pages using four tildes (~~~~); this will automatically produce your name and the date. If you need help, check out [[Wikipedia:Questions]], ask me on my talk page, or place {{helpme}} on your talk page and someone will show up shortly to answer your questions. Again, welcome!  [[User:Addhoc|Addhoc]] 22:49, 10 August 2006 (UTC)

title: Talk:Kudiyirundha Koyil
Talk:Terekeme people
Czech Warmblood
content:
{{citations|date=July 2008}}
{{use dmy dates|date=May 2015}}
{{use list-defined references|date=May 2015}}
{{Infobox horse breed
|name= Czech Warmblood
|image=Ct3.jpg|200px 
|image_caption=Czech Warmblood jumping
|features = 
|altname= {{lang-cz|{{noitalic|Český teplokrevník}}}}
|nickname= 
|country= [[Czech Republic]]
|group1= 
|std1= 
|}}  

The '''Czech Warmblood''', {{lang-cz|'Český teplokrevník'}}, is the [[warmblood]] sport horse of the [[Czech Republic]].{{r|dad}}

==Characteristics==
The Czech Warmblood is a robust, powerful horse bred with strong bones. The breed has a strong neck on an elegant body, a broad, long back, and good hooves, though they are sometimes flat. The mane and tail are very thick. 

The Czech Warmblood is a relatively long-lived, unpretentious and relentless horse. The breed is willing and teachable with a very good temperament. Most are [[black (horse)|black]], [[chestnut (coat)|chestnut]], [[bay (color)|bay]] or dark bay.

==Breed history==
The Czech Warmblood was in existence by the time of the [[Austro-Hungarian]] Empire (1876-1918). In the 19th century the breed was influenced by [[Spain|Spanish]] and [[Italy|Italian]] horses, and later by breeds such as the Furioso, [[Gidran]], [[Nonius (horse)|Nonius]] and [[Przedswit]] breeds. [[German Warmblood]] horses also played a part. 

The most famous and successful line is the [[Bystrý]]. The founder was [[Stallion (horse)|Stallion]] 469, foaled in 1919. The line is characterized by a robustness, shorter and a less solid run, steeper and a shorter fetlock. They are mainly [[Bay (horse)|bay]] horses.

The [[stud farm]] in [[Kladruby nad Labem|Kladruby]] plays a major role in the breeding of the Czech Warmblood. In the pedigree book, many other breeds are mentioned, for example [[Thoroughbred]], [[Selle Francais]], [[Arabian horse|Arabian]] and [[Anglo-Arabian]].

==Uses==
Czech Warmbloods are suited to all [[Equestrianism|horse sports]]. They are good at [[dressage]] and [[horse racing]] and are also capable of lighter farm and forest work, hunting and jumping.

In 2013 the population was reported as about 22,000.{{r|dad}}

==References==

<ref name=dad>[http://dad.fao.org/cgi-bin/EfabisWeb.cgi?sid=0b1613ebf16355cf65f6a05b9a65fe25,reportsreport8a_50008183 Breed data sheet: Cesky teplokrevnik/Czech Republic]. Domestic Animal Diversity Information System of the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations. Accessed May 2015.</ref>


}}

content:

'''Ball and Chain''' is a restaurant, bar, and live music venue located in [[Miami, Florida]].

==History==
The venue opened in 1935<ref name="miamiherald">{{cite web|url=http://www.miamiherald.com/opinion/op-ed/joe-cardona/article3503988.html|title=Two Miami-Dade landmarks close or evolve; another reopens | Miami Herald|publisher=miamiherald.com|accessdate=2015-07-21}}</ref><ref name=Home /> on [[Calle Ocho, Miami|Calle Ocho]] in [[Miami]].<ref name=Jghd>{{cite web|url=http://www.miaminewtimes.com/music/little-havanas-ball-and-chain-our-goal-is-to-make-it-authentic-6477429|title=Little Havana's Ball & Chain: "Our Goal Is to Make It Authentic" | Miami New Times|publisher=miaminewtimes.com|accessdate=2015-07-21}}</ref> It was later renamed the Ball and Chain Club. The venue was one of the most popular in Miami during the Depression era.<ref name=Times>{{cite web|url=http://www.miaminewtimes.com/news/little-havanas-ball-and-chain-club-brings-a-colorful-history-as-it-plans-to-reopen-6396405|title=Little Havana's Ball & Chain Club Brings a Colorful History as It Plans to Reopen | Miami New Times|publisher=miaminewtimes.com|accessdate=2015-07-21}}</ref> Paula Echevarria wrote of the original establishment that, “With an interesting 25-year run, filled with bootleggers, gamblers and outlawed felons as owners, it wound up being one of the only locales that would allow African-American jazz and blues musicians,” in the city of Miami.<ref name=Taste /> Black performers were snuck into the club through a passage from the neighboring hotel despite segregationist laws.<ref name=Times />

In the 1950s the club was sold to Henry Schechtman and Ray Miller.<ref name=Times /> Musicians that played at the spot in early days included [[Billie Holiday]], [[Count Basie]],<ref name=Torres>{{cite web|url=http://www.miaminewtimes.com/restaurants/ball-and-chains-cuban-spring-roll-is-a-rollercoaster-of-flavor-7634671|title=Ball & Chain's Cuban Spring Roll Is a Rollercoaster of Flavor | Miami New Times|publisher=miaminewtimes.com|accessdate=2015-07-21}}</ref> [[Louis Armstrong]],<ref name="oceandrive">{{cite web|url=http://oceandrive.com/Post/the-coolest-people-who-live-in-miami|title=The Coolest Miami Residents|publisher=oceandrive.com|accessdate=2015-07-21}}</ref> [[Nat King Cole]],<ref name=Taste>{{cite web|url=http://www.tastingtable.com/entry_detail/miami/17926/Now_Open_Ball_Chain_in_Little_Havana.htm|title=Now Open Ball & Chain in Little Havana | Tasting Table Miami|publisher=tastingtable.com|accessdate=2015-07-21}}</ref> and [[Duke Ellington]].<ref name="mensjournal">{{cite web|url=http://www.mensjournal.com/travel/cities/miami-the-four-day-weekend-20150106|title=Miami: The Four-Day Weekend - MensJournal.com|publisher=mensjournal.com|accessdate=2015-07-21}}</ref> The [[Gene Krupa]] trio began their national tour at the venue in 1956,<ref name="google">{{cite book|title=Billboard|publisher=Nielsen Business Media, Inc.|issn=0006-2510|url=https://books.google.ca/books?id=dwoEAAAAMBAJ&pg=PA22|page=22|accessdate=2015-07-21}}</ref> and the [[Chet Baker]] played at the club with his Baker Quintet in 1957. The bar closed in 1957 after Count Basie sued the ownership for outstanding fees.<ref name="google2">{{cite book|title=Jade Visions: The Life and Music of Scott LaFaro|author=LaFaro-Fernandez, H.|date=2009|publisher=University of North Texas Press|isbn=9781574412734|url=https://books.google.ca/books?id=KnTSqVu9Zr4C&pg=PA59|page=59|accessdate=2015-07-21}}</ref>

==Reopening==
The venue reopened on September 18, 2014, with new owners Ben Fuller, and brothers Zack and Ben Bush.<ref name="miaminewtimes">{{cite web|url=http://www.miaminewtimes.com/restaurants/ball-and-chain-opens-today-pastelito-daiquiris-and-jazz-on-calle-ocho-6589616|title=Ball & Chain Opens Today: Pastelito Daiquiris and Jazz on Calle Ocho | Miami New Times|publisher=miaminewtimes.com|accessdate=2015-07-21}}</ref> The original roof was retained, however new construction was done to the interior.<ref name=Home>{{cite web|url=http://www.luxurytravelmagazine.com/news-articles/ball-chain-reopens-in-miami-after-50-years-22924.php|title=What's Old is New Again: Iconic and World Famous Ball & Chain Reopens in Miami after 50 Years|publisher=luxurytravelmagazine.com|accessdate=2015-07-21}}</ref> The new interior was designed to reflect the environment that existed during the club’s first run.<ref name=Jghd /> In addition to music, the place also has a kitchen that prepares Cuban tapas dishes and a bar that serves both international and Cuban drinks.<ref name=Taste /> The venue has two stages, with one generally showing jazz-based music and the other salsa.<ref name="cnn">{{cite web|url=http://www.cnn.com/2015/06/10/travel/cnngo-travel-miami/|title=CNNGo in Miami: From Italian gardens to Little Havana - CNN.com|publisher=cnn.com|accessdate=2015-07-21}}</ref> The club also provides dance lessons.<ref name="miamiherald2">{{cite web|url=http://www.miamiherald.com/entertainment/celebrities/article23568490.html|title=Audrina Patridge takes a ‘1st Look’ at Miami | Miami Herald|publisher=miamiherald.com|accessdate=2015-07-21}}</ref> In January 2016 the club began broadcasting a live jazz radio program on [[WDNA]] in Miami called ''Jazz: Live at The Ball & Chain''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.miami.com/ball-amp-chain-debuts-live-jazz-broadcast-wdna-article|title=Ball & Chain debuts live jazz broadcast on WDNA|work=Miami.com}}</ref> The program is played monthly on the station and features the live performances played on the Ball & Chain stage.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.miaminewtimes.com/event/jazz-live-at-the-ball-and-chain-8175045|title=Jazz: Live at the Ball & Chain|work=Miami New Times}}</ref>

==External links==
* [http://www.ballandchainmiami.com/ Restaurant website]

title: User talk:CartoonPikachu
content:
== Welcome! == Hello, CartoonPikachu, and [[Project:Introduction|welcome]] to Wikipedia! Thank you for [[Special:Contributions/CartoonPikachu|your contributions]]. I hope you like the place and decide to stay. Unfortunately, one or more of the pages you created, such as [[Bee & PuppyCat]], may not conform to some of Wikipedia's [[Wikipedia:List of policies|guidelines]], and may not be retained. There's a page about creating articles you may want to read called '''[[Wikipedia:Your first article|Your first article]]'''. If you are stuck, and looking for help, please come to the '''[[Wikipedia:Teahouse/Questions|Tea House]]''', where experienced Wikipedians can answer any queries you have! Or, you can just type '''{{tl|help me}}''' on this page, followed by your question, and someone will show up shortly to answer your questions. Here are a few other good links for newcomers: * [[Wikipedia:Starting an article|Starting an article]] * [[Wikipedia:Your first article|Your first article]] * [[Wikipedia:Biographies of living persons|Biographies of living persons]] * [[Wikipedia:Article development|How to write a great article]] * [[Wikipedia:Five pillars|The five pillars of Wikipedia]] * [[Help:Contents|Help pages]] * [[Wikipedia:Tutorial|Tutorial]] I hope you enjoy editing here and being a [[Wikipedia:Wikipedians|Wikipedian]]! Please [[Wikipedia:Signatures|sign your name]] on talk pages using four tildes (~~~~); this will automatically produce your name and the date. If you have any questions, check out [[Wikipedia:Questions]] or ask me on my talk page. Again, welcome! [[User:Sparklism| — sparklism]] ''[[User_talk:Sparklism| hey!]]'' 08:48, 22 January 2014 (UTC) ==[[Wikipedia:Criteria for speedy deletion|Speedy deletion]] nomination of [[:Bee & PuppyCat]]== [[Image:Ambox warning pn.svg|48px|left|alt=|link=]] {{Quote box|quote=

If this is the first article that you have created, you may want to read [[WP:Your first article|the guide to writing your first article]].

You may want to consider using the [[Wikipedia:Article wizard|Article Wizard]] to help you create articles.

|width=20%|align=right}} A tag has been placed on [[:Bee & PuppyCat]] requesting that it be speedily deleted from Wikipedia. This has been done under [[WP:CSD#A7|section A7 of the criteria for speedy deletion]], because the article appears to be about web content, but it does not indicate how or why the subject is important or significant: that is, why an article about that subject should be included in an encyclopedia. Under the [[WP:CSD#Articles|criteria for speedy deletion]], such articles may be deleted at any time. Please read more about [[Wikipedia:Notability (summary)|what is generally accepted as notable]]. If you think this page should not be deleted for this reason, you may '''contest the nomination''' by [[:Bee & PuppyCat|visiting the page]] and clicking the button labelled "Click here to contest this speedy deletion". This will give you the opportunity to explain why you believe the page should not be deleted. However, be aware that once a page is tagged for speedy deletion, it may be removed without delay. Please do not remove the speedy deletion tag from the page yourself, but do not hesitate to add information in line with [[Wikipedia:List of policies|Wikipedia's policies and guidelines]]. If the page is deleted, and you wish to retrieve the deleted material for future reference or improvement, you can place a request [[WP:RFUD|here]]. [[User:Sparklism| — sparklism]] ''[[User_talk:Sparklism| hey!]]'' 08:48, 22 January 2014 (UTC)

Hello and welcome to Wikipedia.  We appreciate encyclopedic contributions, but some of your recent contributions seem to be advertising or for [[WP:PROMOTION|promotional purposes]].  Wikipedia does not allow advertising.  For more information on this, see:
*[[Wikipedia:Neutral point of view|Policy on neutral point of view]]
*[[Wikipedia:Spam|Guideline on spam]]

If you still have questions, there is a [[Wikipedia:New contributors' help page|new contributor's help page]], or you can write '''<nowiki>{{helpme}}</nowiki>''' below this message along with a question and someone will be along to answer it shortly.  You may also find the following pages useful for a general introduction to Wikipedia:
*[[Wikipedia:Five pillars|The five pillars of Wikipedia]]
*[[Help:Editing|How to edit a page]] and [[Wikipedia:Article development|how to develop articles]]
*[[Help:Contents|Help pages]]

*[[Wikipedia:Article wizard|Article wizard]] for creating new articles
*[[Wikipedia:Manual of Style|Manual of Style]]
I hope you enjoy editing Wikipedia!  Please [[Wikipedia:Sign your posts on talk pages|sign your name]] on talk pages using four tildes (<nowiki>~~~~</nowiki>); this will automatically produce your name and the date. Feel free to write a note on the bottom of my talk page if you want to get in touch with me. Again, welcome! <!-- Template:Welcomespam -->[[User:SwisterTwister|<font color="green">SwisterTwister</font>]] [[User talk:SwisterTwister|<font color="green">talk</font>]] 03:09, 12 November 2011 (UTC)
==[[Wikipedia:Criteria for speedy deletion|Speedy deletion]] nomination of [[:User:Mariapbonner]]==
[[File:Ambox warning pn.svg|left|48px|alt=|link=]]<!-- use [[Image:Ambox_warning_yellow.svg|left|48px|alt=|link=]] for YELLOW flag -->
{{Quote box
 | quote  = You may also wish to consider using a Wizard to help you create articles. See the [[Wikipedia:Article wizard2.0|Article Wizard]].'''''
 | source = Thank you.
 | width  = 20%
 | align  = right
}}
A tag has been placed on '''[[:User:Mariapbonner]]''', requesting that it be speedily deleted from Wikipedia. This has been done under the [[WP:CSD#Articles|criteria for speedy deletion]], because the article seems to be unambiguous advertising that only promotes a company, product, group, service or person and would need to be fundamentally rewritten in order to become an encyclopedia article. Please read [[Wikipedia:Criteria for speedy deletion#G11|the general criteria for speedy deletion]], particularly item G11, as well as [[WP:SPAM|the guidelines on spam]]. 

If you can indicate why the subject of this article is not blatant advertising, [[File:Speedy delete contest button.png|link={{fullurl:{{TALKPAGENAME:User:Mariapbonner}}|action=edit&section=new&preload=Template:Hangon_preload&preloadtitle=This+{{pagetype|subjectspace=yes}}+should+not+be+speedy+deleted+because...+}}]]. Clicking that button will take you to the talk page where you will find a pre-formatted place for you to explain why you believe the page should not be deleted. You can also visit '''[[{{TALKPAGENAME:User:Mariapbonner}}|the article's talk page directly]]''' to give your reasons, but be aware that once tagged for ''speedy'' deletion, if the article meets the criterion, it may be deleted without delay. You may freely add information to the article that would confirm the subject's notability under Wikipedia guidelines. Please do not remove the speedy deletion tag yourself, but don't hesitate to add information to the article that would help make it encyclopedic, as well as adding any [[Wikipedia:Citing sources|citations]] from independent [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources|reliable sources]] to ensure that the article will be [[Wikipedia:Verifiability|verifiable]]. Feel free to leave a note on my talk page if you have any questions about this.[[Category:User talk pages with Spam-warn notices||{{PAGENAME}}]]<!-- Template:Spam-warn -->  [[User:SwisterTwister|<font color="green">SwisterTwister</font>]] [[User talk:SwisterTwister|<font color="green">talk</font>]] 03:09, 12 November 2011 (UTC)

Goddard]] |identification_symbol= |identification_symbol_2= |march= |mascot= |battles= |anniversaries= |decorations= |battle_honours= }} The '''Landi Kotal Brigade''' was an infantry [[formation (military)|formation]] of the [[Indian Army during World War II]]. It was formed in 1920, for service on the [[North-West Frontier Province (1901–1955)|North West Frontier]]. It was normal practice for newly formed battalions to be posted to the North West Frontier for service before being sent to Africa, Burma or Italy.{{cite web|accessdate=2009-10-23|publisher=Order of Battle|title=Landi Kotal Brigade|url=http://www.ordersofbattle.com/UnitData.aspx?UniX=63292&Tab=Uhi}} ==Formation (during World War Two)== *1st [[South Wales Borderers]] September to December 1939 It would be more appropriate to incorporate it into [[History of rail transport in India]]. Regards, [[User:SBC-YPR|SBC-YPR]] ([[User talk:SBC-YPR|talk]]) 06:49, 6 July 2009 (UTC) == Adoption == A user is adopted only when he himself wishes to be. I see that you already suggested Msnanda to put himself for adoption. "Forced" adoption comes under [[Wikipedia:Mentorship|Mentorship]], but again, this would be for serious cases. If the user is too disruptive, he can be put under [[Wikipedia:Editing_restrictions|probation]]. Project news
|- |style="color:#000"|
[[File:India 1947 India Flag 3 and half annas.jpg|195px]]
A number of [[Outline of India|India-related articles]] have '''lost''' their '''[[Wikipedia:Featured articles|featured article]] status''', including [[Sikkim]] and [[Mumbai]]. The article about [[Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi|Gandhi]] was also demoted for [[Wikipedia:Citing sources|referencing]] and [[Wikipedia:How to improve image quality|image quality]] issues. Since then, [[Mumbai]] has been [[Talk:Mumbai/GA1|brought back]] to good article status, thanks to the efforts of [[User:Kensplanet|Kensplanet]] and others. [[Transport in India]] was promoted to '''[[Wikipedia:Good articles|good article]]''' status, thanks to the efforts of [[User:Rsrikanth05|Rsrikanth05]], [[User:SBC-YPR|SBC-YPR]] and [[User:GDibyendu|GDibyendu]]. Several new '''[[Wikipedia:WikiProject India/Workgroups|workgroups]]''' have been formed: WikiProjects [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Railways in India|Railways in India]], [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Education in India|Education in India]] and [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Transport in India|Transport in India]]. Please join us if you're interested in those topics! |- !
To do...
|- | style="color: #000;" | The articles that have been selected for our latest '''[[Wikipedia:WikiProject India/Collaborations of the month|collaborations of the month]]''' are [[history of Mumbai]], [[Indian Railways]], [[rail transport in India]], [[Indian general election, 2009]] and [[telecommunications in India]]. We need your help to improve them! These India-related articles are currently on '''[[Wikipedia:Featured article review|featured article review]]''': [[Kerala]] ([[Wikipedia:Featured article review/Kerala/archive1|FAR]]), [[Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport]] ([[Wikipedia:Featured article review/Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport/archive1|FAR]]) and [[rail transport in India]] ([[Wikipedia:Featured article review/Rail transport in India/archive2|FAR]]). Would you allow these articles to lose their FA status? '''[[Wikipedia:Wikipedia Takes Chennai|Wikipedia Takes Chennai]]''' – a scavenger hunt and free-content photography contest – has started in Chennai, along the same lines as [[Wikipedia:Wikipedia Takes The City|Wikipedia Takes The City]]. We look forward to more contributions from you. To get started, go to the [[Wikipedia:Noticeboard for India-related topics|noticeboard]]. [[Wikipedia:WikiProject India/to do|'''»''']] |} |class="MainPageBG" style="width: 50%; border:1px solid #cedff2; background-color:#f5faff; vertical-align:top"| {| width="100%" cellpadding="2" cellspacing="5" style="vertical-align:top; background-color:#f5faff" !
From the editors...
|- | style="color: #000;" |[[:Category:Wikipedians in Bangalore|Wikipedians in Bangalore]] organised a [[Wikipedia:Meetup/Bangalore/Bangalore3|'''meetup''' on 5 July 2009]]; thanks to [[User:Tinucherian|Tinu Cherian]] for hosting the event! [http://www.arunram.net/blog/2009/07/wikipedians-meetup-in-bangalore/ Arunram] and [http://tinucherian.blogspot.com/2009/07/indian-wikipedians-meet-in-bangalore09.html Tinu Cherian] wrote extensively about the meetup, which was also covered by ''[http://en.wikizine.org/2009/07/year-2009-week-28-number-111.html Wikizine]'', ''[http://www.headlinesindia.com/lifestyle-news/social-networking/indian-wikipedians-meet-in-bangalore-16714.html Headlines India]'' and ''[[Wikipedia:Wikipedia Signpost/2009-07-06/News and notes|The Wikipedia Signpost]]''. Photos have been uploaded to [[:commons:Category:Bangalore Meetup 2009|Wikimedia Commons]]. [http://cis-india.org/author/sunil Sunil Abraham] from the [http://cis-india.org/ Centre for Internet and Society] has offered to help host such events in the future. All in all, the meetup was a great success. Watch out for the [[Wikipedia:Meetup/Bangalore/Bangalore4|next meetup]]! [[Wikipedia:Meetup/Bangalore|»]] [[User:Nichalp|Nichalp]], an Indian [[Wikipedia:Bureaucrats|bureaucrat]] and major contributor to more than 23 India-related featured articles and lists, was [[User_talk:Nichalp#Paid_editing_and_Zithan|desysopped]] over allegations of '''[[Wikipedia:Paid editing|paid editing]]''' and using [[Wikipedia:Sock puppetry|sock puppets]]. An [[Wikipedia:Requests for comment/Paid editing|RfC about paid editing]] was opened as a result of this incident. A prolific editor and [[Wikipedia:Administrators|administrator]], '''[[User:Bhadani|Bhadani]]''' is among the top ten Wikipedians by [[Wikipedia:List of Wikipedians by number of edits|number of edits]] across the English Wikipedia. Congratulations to Bhadani for also making the most number of edits among [[Wikipedia:WikiProject India/List of Indian Wikipedians by number of edits|Indian Wikipedians]]! Are you subscribed to [https://lists.wikimedia.org/mailman/listinfo/wikimediaindia-l wikimediaindia-l] to learn about the latest developments of forming the [[w:meta:Wikimedia India|Indian chapter of Wikimedia]]? Did you know that there are '''[[Wikipedia:IRC channels|IRC channels]]''' for Wikipedians interested in India like you? Check them out at {{IRC|wikipedia-in}} and {{IRC|wikimedia-in}}! Wikipedia's '''[[Portal:India/Quiz|India quiz]]''' remains a hotspot of the community by continuing to attract old and new Wikipedians. You are invited to join in and have fun! This is your newsletter, and you can be involved in the creation of the [[Wikipedia:WikiProject India/Outreach/Newsletter/Newstips|next issue]]. Any and all contributions are welcome – so feel free to join in! Simply let yourself be known to any of the undersigned, or just [[Wikipedia:Be bold|start editing]]!
— [[User:Ncmvocalist|Ncmvocalist]], [[User:RegentsPark|RegentsPark]], ['''[[User:Sd31415|sd]]'''] and [[User:Tinucherian|''' Tinu''']] [[User talk:Tinucherian|'''Cherian ''']]

title: User talk:Kalamundaweb
content: Please do not add advertising or inappropriate external links to Wikipedia{{#if:|, as you did in [[:{{{1}}}]]}}. [[Wikipedia:What Wikipedia is not#Wikipedia is not a directory|Wikipedia is not a mere directory of links]] nor should it be used for advertising or promotion.  Inappropriate links include (but are not limited to) links to personal web sites, links to web sites with which you are affiliated, and links that exist to attract visitors to a web site or promote a product.  See [[Wikipedia:External links|the external links guideline]] and [[Wikipedia:Spam|spam policies]] for further explanations of links that are considered appropriate.  If you feel the link should be added to the article, then please discuss it on the {{#if:|[[talk:{{{1}}}|article's talk page]]|article's talk page}} rather than re-adding it. See the [[Wikipedia:Welcome, newcomers|welcome page]] to learn more about Wikipedia. Thank you.<!-- Template:Spam --> [[User talk:Hesperian|Hesperian]] 12:15, 27 May 2008 (UTC)

title: 1973 Five Nations Championship
content:
{{Infobox Six Nations Championship 2 | name = 1973 Five Nations Championship | image = | imagesize = | caption = | date = 13 January 1973 - 14 April 1973 | countries = {{ru|ENG}}
{{ru|IRE}}
{{ru|FRA}}
{{ru|SCO}}
{{ru|WAL}} | champions = {{ru|ENG}}, {{ru|IRE}}, {{ru|FRA}},
{{ru|SCO}} and {{ru|WAL}} | count = | grand slam = | triple crown = | calcutta cup = {{ru|ENG}} | millennium trophy = | centenary quaich = | giuseppe garibaldi trophy = | matches = 10 | attendance = | tries = | top point scorer = | top try scorer = | website = | previous year = 1972 | previous tournament = 1972 Five Nations Championship | next year = 1974 | next tournament = 1974 Five Nations Championship }} The '''1973 Five Nations Championship''' was the forty-fourth series of the rugby union [[Six Nations Championship|Five Nations Championship]]. Including the previous incarnations as the Home Nations and Five Nations, this was the seventy-ninth series of the northern hemisphere rugby union championship. Ten matches were played between 13 January and 14 April.It was contested by [[England national rugby union team|England]], [[France national rugby union team|France]], [[Ireland national rugby union team|Ireland]], [[Scotland national rugby union team|Scotland]] and [[Wales national rugby union team|Wales]]. As each nation won their two home matches (and therefore lost their two away matches), the championship was shared between all five teams; no further tie-break was applied to separate teams finishing level on match points. This was the only time that the Five Nations championship finished in a five-way tie. Due to the [[Troubles]] occurring in Ireland, which had resulted in the loss of over 100 British soldiers in 1972 and the potential risks both Scotland and Wales refused to play Ireland in Dublin. Defying expectations to the contrary, England agreed to travel. Despite a poor performance, resulting in an 18-9 loss, England received great credit for their attendance coupled with captain John Pullin's post-match quip "Well we might not be any good but at least we turned up".{{cite news| url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/rugbyunion/international/ireland/9857630/Six-Nations-2013-the-day-John-Pullins-England-turned-up-40-years-ago-to-revive-Irish-rugby-during-Troubles.html | title=Memory of England Rugby's Travel to Dublin in Troubles | publisher=The Telegraph| date=8 February 2013|accessdate=20 August 2015}} ==Participants== The teams involved were: {|class="wikitable" !'''Nation''' !'''Venue''' !'''City''' !'''Head coach''' |- |{{ru|ENG}} |[[Twickenham Stadium|Twickenham]] |[[London]] |John Burgess |- |{{ru|FRA}} |[[Parc des Princes]] |[[Paris]] |[[Jean Desclaux]] |- |{{Ru|IRE}} |[[Lansdowne Road]] |[[Dublin]] |[[Syd Millar]] |- |{{ru|SCO}} |[[Murrayfield Stadium|Murrayfield]] |[[Edinburgh]] |[[Bill Dickinson]] |- |{{ru|WAL}} |[[Cardiff Arms Park|National Stadium]] |[[Cardiff]] |[[Clive Rowlands]] |} ==Table== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !rowspan=2 width="8%"| Position !rowspan=2 width="18%"| Nation !colspan=4 width="32%"| Games !colspan=3 width="32%"| Points !rowspan=2 width="10%"| Table

title: User talk:ALbD Communications
content:
{{#if:{{{header|}}}|=={{{header-text|[[:ALBD]]}}}==}} A tag has been placed on [[:ALBD]], requesting that it be speedily deleted from Wikipedia. This has been done under the [[WP:CSD#Articles|criteria for speedy deletion]], because the article seems to be blatant advertising which only promotes a company, product, group or service and which would need to be fundamentally rewritten in order to become an encyclopedia article. Please read [[Wikipedia:Criteria for speedy deletion#G11|the general criteria for speedy deletion]], particularly item 11, as well as [[WP:SPAM|the guidelines on spam]]. If you can indicate why the subject of this article is not blatant advertising, you may contest the tagging. To do this, please add {{tl|hangon}} on the top of the page and leave a note on [[Talk:ALBD|the article's talk page]] explaining your position. Please do not remove the speedy deletion tag yourself, but don't hesitate to add information to the article that would help make it encyclopedic, as well as adding any [[Wikipedia:Citing sources|citations]] from [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources|reliable sources]] to ensure that the article will be [[Wikipedia:Verifiability|verifiable]]. Feel free to leave a note on my talk page if you have any questions about this. Please also familiarize yourself with [[WP:COI|the conflict of interest policy]]. Thanks. [[User:Ju66l3r|ju66l3r]] 18:34, 8 January 2007 (UTC) You have recently recreated or reposted material which previously was deleted in accordance with Wikipedia's [[WP:DP|deletion policies]]{{ #if: Active living by design |  at [[:Active living by design]]}}. Please do not recreate this article without prior approval from an [[Wikipedia:Administrators|administrator]] or '''you may be [[Wikipedia:Blocking policy|blocked]]''' from editing. We ask that you respect [[Wikipedia:What Wikipedia is not|what Wikipedia is not]]. If you disagree with the article's deletion, you may seek an independent [[Wikipedia:Deletion review|deletion review]]. [[User:Fan-1967|Fan-1967]] 21:50, 8 January 2007 (UTC) [[Image:Stop_hand.svg|left|30px]] This is your '''last warning'''.
The next time you [[Wikipedia:Vandalism|vandalize]] a page, {{#if:Active living by design|as you did to [[:Active living by design]],}} you will be [[Wikipedia:Blocking policy|blocked]] from editing Wikipedia. [[User:Zoe]]|[[User talk:Zoe|(talk)]] 21:54, 8 January 2007 (UTC) ==From the deleted Active living by design talk page== I'm creating the Wikipedia entry for Active Living by Design. It's a non-profit project that has no commercial endeavors. I'm having a hard time understanding why a page about our organization is considered adverising or even "vandalism". Any assistance will be greatly appreciated. — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:ALbD Communications|ALbD Communications]] ([[User talk:ALbD Communications|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/ALbD Communications|contribs]]) :Non-profits advertise all the time. Our standards do not distinguish between commercial and non-commercial enterprises. It was clearly self-promotional and advertorial, and quite frankly read like a press release, nothing like an encyclopedic article. [[User:Fan-1967|Fan-1967]] 22:01, 8 January 2007 (UTC) :Furthermore, please read the [[WP:COI|Conflict of Interest]] guidelines that are applied to everyone at Wikipedia. You should not be creating (and even limiting any editing) of articles that your username suggests that you are affiliated with. It destroys the [[WP:NPOV|neutrality]] required of all editors when working on articles here. The gist is that if the ALbD program is notable, per [[WP:CORP]] or [[WP:ORG]], then more than likely someone else will write an article about it/you. Thanks. [[User:Ju66l3r|ju66l3r]] 22:16, 8 January 2007 (UTC)

title: User talk:Jfrasch
content: '''Welcome!''' Hello, {{PAGENAME}}, and [[Wikipedia:Welcome, newcomers|welcome]] to Wikipedia! Thank you for your contributions. I hope you like the place and decide to stay. Here are a few good links for newcomers: *[[Wikipedia:Five pillars|The five pillars of Wikipedia]] *[[Wikipedia:How to edit a page|How to edit a page]] *[[Help:Contents|Help pages]] *[[Wikipedia:Tutorial|Tutorial]] *[[Wikipedia:How to write a great article|How to write a great article]] *[[Wikipedia:Manual of Style|Manual of Style]] I hope you enjoy editing here and being a [[Wikipedia:Wikipedians|Wikipedian]]! Please [[Wikipedia:Sign your posts on talk pages|sign your name]] on talk pages using four tildes (~~~~); this will automatically produce your name and the date. If you need help, check out [[Wikipedia:Where to ask a question]], ask me on my talk page, or place {{helpme}} on your talk page and someone will show up shortly to answer your questions. Again, welcome!  --[[User:malathion|malathion]] [[User talk:malathion|talk]] 04:37, 29 July 2005 (UTC) ==Enviga from Coca Cola Nestle== I am just curious where did you first came accross this product back in 2005 ? was supposed to be confidential info until now ?--[[User:Netquantum|Netquantum]] 17:56, 16 October 2006 (UTC)

title: Talk:UFC 112
content: {{WikiProject Mixed Martial Arts|class=start}} ==Venue?== Anybody know what the venue would be? [[User:Trunks8719|Trunks8719]] ([[User talk:Trunks8719|talk]]) 05:55, 13 December 2009 (UTC) I'm confused as to why Abu Dhabi has been put on here... The rumours were for London. There have been no announcements stating that a venue/country has been targeted. UFC Presidant Dana White said "sounds like a good idea to me" when asked if the Matt Hughes vs Renzo Gracie fight would take place in Abu Dhabi. Thats about as vague as you can get. —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:PabloHassan|PabloHassan]] ([[User talk:PabloHassan|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/PabloHassan|contribs]]) 19:52, 15 December 2009 (UTC) ==Edit request== {{tld|editsemiprotected}} Vitor Belfort vs. Anderson Silva is off and should be removed from the page. It's pure speculation with no hard facts to back it up as Anderson has been recovering from elbow surgery. —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:ACCBiggz|ACCBiggz]] ([[User talk:ACCBiggz|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/ACCBiggz|contribs]]) 02:47, 5 January 2010 [[File:Red information icon with gradient background.svg|20px|link=|alt=]] '''Not done:''' Welcome and thanks for wanting to improve the accuracy of this article. The tenatative matchup is sourced and qualified as tentative. It would be better to have some reliable source that this isn't going to happen, or that it will happen at a different event, before making that change. You are autoconfirmed now, so feel free to make the change if you feel differently. I'm just recommending, as a fellow editor, that you find a source first. [[User:Celestra|Celestra]] ([[User talk:Celestra|talk]]) 04:03, 5 January 2010 (UTC) == Main Event Scores == What is the source for the scores of the Silva/Maia Fight (As they were not announced during the broadcast)? —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/24.215.217.241|24.215.217.241]] ([[User talk:24.215.217.241|talk]]) 02:56, 11 April 2010 (UTC) == Sources for Sales == Some of these "gate" figures are highly suspicious. Where are they coming from? According to this, the ''average'' ticket price was $320+. I could maybe believe this was a special case, but for 111 the average ticket price came out be over $220, too. Since the cheap seats are always the most numerous kind available, this just doesn't add up. [[User:Senor Vergara|Senor Vergara]] ([[User talk:Senor Vergara|talk]]) 03:48, 11 April 2010 (UTC)

title: User talk:99.236.212.36
content:
